question_text: Which of the following are valid reasons to assign a static IP instead of using DHCP? (Select all that apply)
answer_options: The device must always be accessible at the same address
The network has very frequent power outages
The device runs a service that clients connect to regularly
The network does not support IP routing
The device lacks support for DHCP
correct_answer: The device must always be accessible at the same address
The device runs a service that clients connect to regularly
The device lacks support for DHCP
explanation: Static IPs are commonly used for servers and legacy devices needing fixed addresses. DHCP is not suitable in these cases.
